result.execSummary:
All charges against Larry Morgan Jr in this case have been dismissed. These charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Larry Morgan Jr is presumed innocent.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Larry Morgan Jr

From: T.T Re: prior violations in WI & MN
TWB: ?
Def NA - CRT:  Warrant to remain

State by John Kellis; 
2:31 He was suppose to stop by JS to sign bond and he never did - notice went out 3-31st - and he is not here - warrant bond 750.00 and if picked up he must come to Branch 3 to be reviewed

Per JSS:  I was asked to call Ms. K, girlfriend of client, & she stated def could live at her address [address & phone given].
PER TWB:  Advise def to appear in CRT or Warrant will be issued - he needs to sign his bond - Hrg: 4-7-15 @ 2:30
Per Amy, JSS:  I was able to reach the client w/ this info - def's phone # is 612-206-4051

from COC   re: Def appeared as John Doe at IA on 3-18-15.  It was later determined that def's name is Larry Morgan & CRT issued a Sig bond but JSS was to verify his address before his release on Sig bond.  The def was released w/o actually signing the Sig bond.  The COC called def at phone # given on bond & spoke w/ woman who stated no one lives there by that name.  The COC called a 2nd time & left msg for def to call back, no call has been rec'd - how should we proceed?
PER TWB:  I would like JSS to advise me on how his residence was confirmed.  Then I will issue warrants on Motion of the State.  Set for Hrg w/ Notice to Def

Def in custody
  Def pleads NG - NG pleas entered
